de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.view
Class DataGeneratorActions

java.lang.Object
  de.uni.bamberg.wiai.minf.forflow.datagenerator.view.DataGeneratorActions

public class DataGeneratorActions
extends java.lang.Object

Here is where the actions caused by the UI main frame are handled. The actions origins are DataGeneratorView, but they are processed further here. The actions itself may passed on to the controller.

Since:
Apr/06/09
Version:
0.1
Author:
Michael Munz

Constructor Detail

DataGeneratorActions

public DataGeneratorActions(DataGeneratorView view)
constructor is passed the reference of the view and creates its needed components.

Method Detail

openAboutDialog

protected void openAboutDialog()
passes the call to open the about dialog to the application framework.

loadModel

protected void loadModel(java.net.URI workingDir)
method is invoked from the DataGeneratorView and opens up a file chooser dialog where the tester has the opportunity to browse for a proper file to load into the system.

Parameters:
workingDir - its the latest dir from which a file has been deserialzed.

openNullValuesDialog

protected void openNullValuesDialog()
passes the call to open null value dialog to the controller layer where it is processed further in background.

openMultiplicityValuesDialog

protected void openMultiplicityValuesDialog()
passes the call to open the multiplicity dialog to the controller layer. At controller layer it is job is done in background to get rid off of annoying EDT blocking behaviour.

openChooseArtefactsDialog

public void openChooseArtefactsDialog()
offers the opportunity to select those artefacts of an EMF Ecore Model, to which test data should going to be generated. The dialog opens up only, if the parsing of the Model was successful.

loadFacets

protected void loadFacets(javax.swing.tree.TreePath path,
                          javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode selectedNode)
method is invoked by main view and passes its call to the controller layer. The controller load the corresponding facets to an artefact in background to disburden the EDT. When done, the found facets are displayed in a table fashioned way.

Parameters:
path - the whole path to a node
selectedNode - the name of the artefact to update. At that point it is still a tree node of the UI. It is converted to an actual artefact when the call arrives its destination. Any job other than passing it through could be too time consuming to the EDT.

addFacet

protected void addFacet()
this method passes the add facet call to the controller layer. Controller knows all the necessary steps, conditions and constraints to fulfill this call.

deleteFacet

protected void deleteFacet()
this method hands the call down to controller layer where a facet is going to be removed. Remember, only controller layer has the access to model layer to make the proper changes in the data structure.

createNewArtefact

protected void createNewArtefact()
to create a new artefact significant changes in the model layer must be done. This is only allowed to controller layer. Therefore, we pass this call on to controller.

deleteArtefact

protected void deleteArtefact(javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel model,
                              javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode nodeToDelete,
                              boolean isAbstractTerm)
method passes it on to Controller layer where all the work is done. Controller decides whether it runs this in background and does the updates of the model, because the layer knows all the steps a deletion causes.

Parameters:
model - tree where a selected element (node) is gonna be dismissed
nodeToDelete - the node to kick
isAbstractTerm - flag, indicates whether a whole collection, it is linked to, will be deleted.
See Also:
DataGeneratorView.deleteArtefact()

generateData

protected void generateData(java.net.URI workingDir)
this method is all about generating test data to artefacts. To actually generate data, there is much more work to do in background and only controller has the rights to do so. As a matter of fact, this method is passed on, too.

Parameters:
workingDir - current working directory. We jump right there

saveProject

protected void saveProject()
this method passes on the save project call. To save a current project session is a great help to every tester. This method allows to mirror current conditions to any persistent storage.

updateArtefact

protected void updateArtefact(java.util.List<MetaClass> artefacts,
                              javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel treeModel,
                              javax.swing.JTree tree,
                              ArtefactType type)
this method is called from within DataGeneratorView whenever an update has occurred.

Parameters:
artefacts - the current list of artefacts to display in UI
treeModel - the component that displays the data
tree - tree component in UI
type - defines which type of artfacts to update

updateQuantity

protected void updateQuantity(int quantity,
                              javax.swing.tree.TreePath path,
                              javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode node)
method passes the parameters on to the controller layer. It's a pass-through method.

Parameters:
quantity - amount of test data to generate
path - the path where the selected node resides
node - the selected tree node

updateUnit

protected void updateUnit(java.util.List<java.lang.String> units,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          javax.swing.JTree tree,
                          javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel model)
method will be invoked, when an unit in model layer has changed state. It's a pass-through method from main view and passes on to controller layer.

Parameters:
units - the data of the unit that has changed structure. This is the latest data.
name - the name of the unit that has had notified.
tree - the tree component
model - the tree model holding the data

updateUnitCustom

protected void updateUnitCustom(java.util.List<Custom> units,
                                java.lang.String name,
                                javax.swing.JTree tree,
                                javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel model)
it's invoked when an unit in model layer has send out a notification to its observers to get the latest update. An update occurs, when the state changes.

Parameters:
units - the latest data of an unit that has had notified to update
name - the name of the unit type
tree - the tree component in the UI.
model - the corresponding tree model holding the data to display.

fillType_ExternalFile_SelectFile

protected java.net.URI fillType_ExternalFile_SelectFile(java.net.URI workingDir)
used by: FillType.External file

Seeding an attribute (facet) with data by linking to an external file. The file lies outside the system. With this method the tester has the opportunity to browses to the desired file and registers the path. With the given path the system knows where to find the file and how to use it.

Parameters:
workingDir - the latest dir where a file has been loaded.
Returns:
path of selected file

fillType_Editor_Save

protected void fillType_Editor_Save(java.net.URI workingDir,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> values)
used by: FillType.Editor

With the editor the tester has the opportunity to create a list with values used by the filling algorithm. If the list is complex, for convenience, a method to save the typed in text is appropriate. So the list can be reused and is serialized.

Method opens up a file browser to save the file anywhere.

Parameters:
workingDir - the latest dir which has been used. We use it to jump to it right there.
values - the list with values which had been typed in

fillType_Editor_Load

protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> fillType_Editor_Load(java.net.URI dir)
gets a call by DataGeneratorView.fillTypeEditorLoad() and passes it on to the background task. The result is then passed backwards to the invoker.

Parameters:
dir - the directory
Returns:
a list of values

getChooseArtefactsDialog

public ChooseArtefacts getChooseArtefactsDialog()
gets the ChooseArtefacts dialog. This method is used to fill the components with data before the dialog is shown to the user.

Returns:
choose artefacts dialog

getNullValuesDialog

public NullValues getNullValuesDialog()
gets the NullValues dialog. This is, because components are filled with data before shown to users.

Returns:
null value dialog

getMultiplicityDialog

public Multiplicity getMultiplicityDialog()
gets the Multiplicity dialog. Because we fill the components with data before it is shown to users.

Returns:
multiplicity dialog

getView

public DataGeneratorView getView()
returns the reference of the main view.

Returns:
ref. to main frame.
